feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Datasphere
feed.subtitle: SAP Datasphere Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Is it possible to publish an SAC dashboard as a Data Product in the SAP Datasphere Marketplace?
entry.content:
Hey everyone,
Is it possible to publish an SAC dashboard as a Data Product in the SAP Datasphere Marketplace and then open it via a URL?
Additionally, if this is possible, can specific permissions (e.g., access rights to the dashboard) be requested or managed through the Data Product?

Thank you for your support!

entry.title: How to dynamically split comma-separated values into multiple rows in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
I am working in SAP Datasphere (Data Builder ‚Äì Graphical View) and I have a column that contains comma-separated values inside a single row. Example:

ID

Observee(s)

19195

0039270, 0040932, 00051689

43400

00055233

121461

NULL

My requirement is to dynamically split these comma-separated values into individual rows, like this:

ID

Observee

19195

0039270

19195

0040932

19195

00051689

43400

00055233

I need a solution that is 

Dynamic (not limited to a fixed number of values like 5 or 10)

 Works in SAP Datasphere (Graphical View OR HANA SQL

Works even when:

  • number of comma-separated values varies per row
  • values sometimes contain spaces
  • column type is NVARCHAR
  • JSON_TABLE or STRING_TO_TABLE are not supported
  • Recursion is not enabled in Datasphere SQL View 
  • So far, I tried:
  • JSON_TABLE() ‚Üí not supported
  • STRING_TO_TABLE() ‚Üí not supported
  • Recursive CTE ‚Üí not allowed inside Data Builder SQL View
  • Regular expression functions ‚Üí no REGEXP_SUBSTR in Graphical View
  • Calculated Columns ‚Üí no built-in SPLIT or explode function

Is there any recommended Datasphere pattern for splitting CSV string fields into multiple records?

Is this possible in:

  • Graphical View (Projection, Aggregation, Calculated Column, etc.)
    or
  • SQL View using functions supported by SAP HANA Cloud?

If someone can provide either:

A working SQL example

or

A correct modeling approach in Datasphere

entry.title: Error when querying a SAC story that consumes data from an analytical model in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently experiencing issues running SAC stories that consume SAP Datasphere analytical models. This issue has arisen during this summer. We have already created a SAP CASE, but we haven‚Äôt received any solution yet . For now, expanding the SAP Datasphere parameters is ruled out due to its extra cost.

We would appreciate any help to unblock this problem. The issue is that the execution time of SAC stories has increased significantly (there hasn‚Äôt been any notable increase in data), and in the worst cases, the report execution ends with a timeout (we are aware of the 3-minute limitation).

What concerns us is that the SAC report only displays a table with about 20,000 records. The analytical model consumes a view that is persisted. Furthermore, there are no other processes running in parallel, and the number of SAC executions is minimal.

The error message is:

"code":"inaTimeout","details":{"stack":"See correlation id ada620af-5346-439b-5037-5292cab57589","message":"execution aborted by timeout, Code: 613, SQL State: HY000","code":613,"sqlState":"HY000","name":"HanaError","originalMessage":"execution aborted by timeout"}}

The note related to SAC Timeout is:

0003584795 - Timeout Issue with Analytic Model in SAP Datasphere

Thanks in advance.

Regards,

Miquel

entry.title: How to Write to Space-Owned Tables (FSDM_DEMO) in SAP Datasphere ?
entry.content:
Hello,

We have a local table DQ_RESULTS in the FSDM_DEMO space in SAP Datasphere.
Using the Datasphere UI, we can load data into this table through Data Flows or Transformation Flows without any issue.

However, we want to implement a stored procedure that should:

  1. Read records from the view DQ_RULE_GENERATED_VW, which contains dynamically generated SQL statements (as column values).

  2. Execute each of these SQL statements dynamically.

  3. Insert the results into the DQ_RESULTS table in the FSDM_DEMO space.

Since SAP Datasphere does not support creating stored procedures directly in the UI, we attempted to build the procedure using the HANA Database Explorer.
But the database user available to us does not have the required SELECT/INSERT privileges on the FSDM_DEMO schema, so the procedure cannot read from or write to the table.

We also tried creating a Database User Group (DUG).
The DUG schema that gets created does not have read/write access to the DQ_RESULTS table in FSDM_DEMO.

We tested multiple users:

  • FSDM_DEMO# ‚Üí does not have read/write access to DQ_RESULTS

  • DWCDBUSER# ‚Üí has only SELECT, no INSERT privileges

So far, none of the technical options allow us to run a stored procedure or write into FSDM_DEMO tables.

Additional Issue

We are also connecting to the DQ_RESULTS table via a Python script using the DWCDBUSER# user.
Again, this user can read the table but cannot write to it.

All our tables, views, and flows are created inside the FSDM_DEMO space, so we need a supported way to write to these Datasphere-owned objects from:

  • Stored procedures

  • Database User Group schemas

  • External scripts (Python)

At the moment we are completely blocked due to insufficient privileges, and it‚Äôs unclear whether such write access is intentionally restricted by design or if we are missing a configuration step.

Question

Is there any supported approach in SAP Datasphere that allows:

  • dynamic SQL execution,

  • writing results into a space-owned table,

  • or enabling external tools (like Python) to write into space-managed objects?

If stored procedures, DUG schemas, and tenant-level users are intentionally restricted from inserting into space object tables, guidance on alternative supported patterns would be very helpful.

Any help or clarification would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Mayura

entry.title: SAP Datasphere vs Others (GCP, Azure, etc) - Business Case ??
entry.content:
Dear all,

I hope you have a very nice day! Sorry for the long question below. I am trying to set up the context and get some other inputs than what I see at the moment.

I am currently working with a client trying to make his way in the great world of Data. Basically, the situation is that the core processes of a Business Area will run with SAP (target is 1 instance and not 3 as today, ECC for now, but S/4 in the near future), and other specific applications. The implementation of SAP involved the implementation of a BW on HANA system (Yes, I know...not the latest stuff). But instead of feeding the BW through regular datasource extractions, they leveraged an SLT system to be near real time for most of their reports sourcing data from their current various SAP landscape. So, they have "rebuilt" lots of calculation views to support their business users. They also have many front ends (BOBJ, PowerBI, Spotfire, and other specialized applications). The maturity of BI is still, not low, but more oriented on checking consistency, very operational and less strategic than it could be. 

So we have : ECCs -> SLT -> HANA DB -> CalcViews -> Composite Providers (for managing authorizations)

They are at a stage of the implementation where the question has been raised to move to SAP Datasphere or to another data manager provider (something like Azure, GCP, Snowflake). The question is raised because they do not have only SAP data, and the overall group (other business areas are in the group) direction is to go to a non SAP landscape for data analytics.

The current exercise is to analyze the options, and choose the most long term viable one: staying with SAP analytics solutions, or moving away. In my current analysis, I am struggling because I don't find any "automatic" ways to convert/migrate the calculation views from BW on HANA directly to SAP Datasphere, provided by SAP. 

I have found the HANACV2SQL software, but I would have had expected SAP to support that kind of scenario. 

So, my question is : What could be the arguments to keep SAP Datasphere when:

  • what ever happens, you will need to convert using the same tool at the same costs ?
  • connectivity to front ends will be subject to reinstallation
  • row level security needs to be reimplemented 
  • SAP Datasphere restricts "data replication" to other systems if the data is used for other applications.

I have been working in the SAP ecosystem for a long time, and the Analytics strategy has always been hard to implement with SAP. The 0 copy concepts and the sharing capabilities promoted by SAP Datasphere (even the partnerships with Snowflake and GCP) are not clear form my point of view. Even if the client is SAP Centric, you need dedicated resources on the technology, which could lead to higher costs...

Any arguments that you have seen promoting one side more than another ?

 

Thanks for reading and sharing üòâ

 

Cheers

entry.title: Scheduling a story based on a live SAP Datasphere solution connection
entry.content:
Hi, 

in the roadmap I have seen that it should now be possible to schedule SAC stories based on datasphere data.

But apparently you need to have a tunnel connection rather then a live connection.

Does someone know how to setup such a connection as I couldn't find something in the documentation for datasphere.

BR Joscha

entry.title: How to update a source of an UNION in a graphical view
entry.content:
Hi,

We‚Äôve encountered another usability issue and a bug in the graphical views when using UNION. Let‚Äôs see if anyone has a different approach that makes it work.

We have views that perform a union of different data sources. The problem arises when one of the data sources adds new fields. When opening the UNION view, it indicates that the new fields have been excluded from the projection, which is fine so far.

The issue comes when you include them back in the projection, and DSP automatically adds them as new fields to the UNION:

  • If you wanted to do a manual mapping, you have to review the fields and delete them ‚Ä¶ extra work.
  • If the technical name already exists in the UNION, then it maps the field to the existing one but also adds the field, causing an error in the view due to duplicate fields.

Here‚Äôs an example:
We have a field "Line Currency" (technical name: LINE_CURRENCY) that is already in the UNION OUTPUT and mapped by other sources, but not by the source we are updating.

Now that source is updated and the field is added. When we make it visible, that‚Äôs when it does the "magic" and breaks everything.

The added field is mapped to the existing "Line Currency", but it adds also the added field, generating the output with 2 fields with same Techical name.

Bonus Track: The validation of the UNION is OK, but the validation of the view FAILS due to duplicated values in techincal names (It seems that UNION is more "laid-back" üòÑ ).

This repeats every time we update a view in the union ‚Ä¶ creating risk and lack of confidence because it modifies something automatically, generating errors, and we have to manually review the process to delete duplicate fields, ensure they are correctly mapped, and of course review everything again. With an average of about 40 fields and 10-15 sources per union, we end up losing a lot of time on this.

Maybe someone has another way to do it?

entry.title: Datasphere: Hiding dimensions used for filtering from the Analytic Model reporting structure
entry.content:
Hello,

In BW Queries, there is the option to filter on a characteristic which is not necessarily part of the drill-down structure of the query. In Datasphere if I choose to uncheck the dimension from the source, I cannot define a filter on it, but I also don't have (or can't find) the option to somehow exclude that from the AM reporting structure if I have a filter defined on it. Kind of how Measures can be made "Auxilary", but for Dimensions.

Here is an example:

I have 0VENDOR and MAT_SALES__0VENDOR. I would like to filter on MAT_SALES__0VENDOR, but report on 0VENDOR and remove MAT_SALES__0VENDOR from the structure to avoid confusion in reporting(not see it in the Preview, nor SAC)

Can someone confirm that this is not available and if not, please enlighten me on how it's done.

Regards,

Dimitar

entry.title: Executing Dynamic SQL from a Parameterized View in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working with SAP Datasphere and facing challenges executing dynamic SQL statements that are generated and stored in a parameterized view. I wanted to share my problem in detail and clarify the limitations I encountered, in case it helps others.

 

Scenario

I have a parameterized view DQ_RULE_GENERATED_VW that generates SQL statements dynamically based on some input parameters.

The view returns a column called GENERATED_SQL along with other metadata.

 

My goal is to execute these SQL statements dynamically within SAP Datasphere and capture the results in a table for downstream processing.

 

Challenges

1. Script Operators in Data Flows cannot execute arbitrary SQL:

    • Datasphere Python Script Operators only process DataFrames from upstream sources.
    • You cannot call a parameterized view directly or run SQL dynamically using sql.execute_query inside a Script Operator.

2. Parameterized views cannot be used as sources:

    • Script Operators and many Datasphere operators only accept materialized tables or non-parameterized views.

3. No direct write access to space-owned tables:

    • Even if I fetch results externally (e.g., with a Python script using a HANA connection), I cannot write the results back into Datasphere UI due to lack of privileges on space-owned tables.

    •  

    • I tried writing a stored procedure that executes the SQL statements dynamically, but it cannot write the results into the target table for the same reason. It seems DML operations can only be performed inside the Datasphere UI, not externally.

    •  

4. External execution works but is not automated:

  • I was able to fetch the GENERATED_SQL column using an external Python script, execute each statement dynamically, and get the results.
  • However, I cannot send the results back into Datasphere without write access.
  • Exporting results as CSV and manually uploading them is possible, but I would like a fully automated solution without manual steps.

 

Request for Community Input

I would like to know:

  1. Is there a fully supported way in Datasphere to execute SQL dynamically from a parameterized view?
  2. Are there recommended best practices for dynamically executing rules generated from parameterized views in Datasphere, especially when you don‚Äôt have write access to space-owned tables?

Any guidance or insights would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks,
Mayura

entry.title: Datasphere : Why we cannot replicate data in delta from CO-PA Datasource ?
entry.content:
I try to create a replication flow from the standard ECC CO-PA datasource to Datasphere, I cannot set the delta mode because of this message :

"Replicating ABAP-based objects that do not have a primary key is only possible for load type "Initial Only".

Any idea ? I suppose the CO-PA table did have a primary key !

Thanks.

Vincent.

entry.title: How to calculate CU consumption and cost for a specific table in SAP Datasphere?
entry.content:
I want to understand how to estimate the Capacity Unit (CU) usage and monthly cost for a specific table stored in SAP Datasphere / SAP HANA Cloud.

For example, I have a table with the following details

  • Size On Disk (MiB)
    0.76
    Size In-Memory (MiB)
    0.6
    Number of Records
    5844
     
    Time Table
     
    SAP.TIME.M_TIME_DIMENSION

I‚Äôm trying to determine:

  1. How to calculate the CU consumption per hour and per month for this table.

  2. How to convert the CU usage into cost, using the standard pricing (e.g., 1 CU = USD 0.87 per month).

  3. Whether compute memory or storage contributes more to the total CU usage.

  4. If there is an official formula or documentation for calculating CU at a per-table level.

What is the recommended method or formula for estimating CU consumption and cost for an individual table in SAP Datasphere?

entry.title: Excel on Share-point as a datasource for Datasphere
entry.content:
We have many requirements where Excel documents stored in SharePoint needs to be replicated to Datasphere as local or remote table. Since the excel data is constantly changing,  the data has to be replicated at least daily. Since there is no native sharepoint connector We have been managing through an open connector on SAP BTP integration suite. However this method is mentioned as a deprecated service from 2026. What are the alternative options we can use?

Thank you.

Niroshini

entry.content:
Hi

I am currently trying to get metadata from cds views in replication flows for the logon language of the connection to S4. Even though the base tables/remote tables displays text in logon language it is not the same case with CDS views.

Do anybody know a way to get metadata in other languages than EN to sap datasphere ?

entry.title: YTD Calculation in Restricted/Calculated Measure with 200 Dimensions in SAP DataSphere
entry.content:
Context and Goal

We are building an Analytic Model in SAP Datasphere, based on a view with approximately 200 columns/dimensions. Our goal is to calculate the Year-to-Date (YTD) value for the measure "SalesAmount". The YTD calculation must be dynamic, allowing the end-user to analyze the result by Year, Month, and any of the ~198 remaining dimensions in the model (example: Customer, Product, Region, etc.).

Attempted Solutions and Specific Issue
 We have tried to implement the YTD calculation directly within the Analytic Model, following SAP documentation:

1. Restricted Measure Attempt: 

     Expression: We defined a restricted measure for "SalesAmount" with the following filter condition on the date dimension ("SalesDate"):  SalesDate IN (YTD(SalesDate))

     Result: The model fails to activate. Upon deployment, Datasphere throws the following syntax error:

           Reason: Invalid syntax or usage of unsupported function. unexpected character: ->Y<- at offset: 0, skipped 3 characters.

Observation: The YTD() function does not seem to be recognized or supported in this context/syntax, despite being suggested by the expression editor.

2. Calculated Measure Attempt:

  • Expression: We also tried creating a calculated measure using the YTD() function:  YTD(SalesAmount, SalesDate)

  • Result: The outcome is the same; the model fails to activate and shows the identical syntax error related to the 'Y' character.

3. SQL View Implementation (Window Function):

  • Approach: We tried calculating the running total using the OVER (PARTITION BY Year ORDER BY Month) window function within the source view (View Builder).

  • Limitation: This approach is unworkable because it limits the drill-down capability. The calculation is performed only at the Year/Month level, and since it is a calculated column in the view, we cannot dynamically disaggregate the YTD by the other ~198 dimensions in the model (e.g., if we filter by a specific "Customer", the calculated YTD would still be the total across all customers up to that "Month").

4. SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud) - Import Model Test:

  • Approach: We created an Import Model in SAC, and there, the YTD() function (implemented as a calculated account) works perfectly and allows for dynamic drill-down across all dimensions.

  • Limitation: This forces us to lose the Real-Time capability of SAP Datasphere and the Live Connection, which is an unacceptable trade-off for our use case.

Question to the Community

Is there an alternative, supported syntax or method in SAP Datasphere, within the Analytic Consumption Model (or a dynamically aggregate-aware View Builder approach) to calculate YTD while respecting all dimensions in the model?

Any workaround or confirmation on whether the YTD() function in Restricted or Calculated Measures is actually supported in the current version of Datasphere would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your assistance!

entry.title: Datasphere SQL: expected_unsigned_integer error on tinyint
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm trying to write a simple SQL script that echoes the value passed through an input parameter. I would like to use this in a derive-value variable so the format and length must match. Therefore I would also like to cast the value to a field of certain length (another Input Parameter). 

The following SQL code doesn't validate and the error I get is: "expected_unsigned_integer". IP_LEN is type HANA.tinyint which is unsigned, so I'm not sure what the problem is here. Any ideas?

SELECT CAST(:IP_VAL as VARCHAR(:IP_LEN)) VALUE
FROM DUMMY_TABLE;

Regards,

Dimitar

entry.title: Datasphere: Issues creating data federation connection between datasphere and S/4hana on-prem
entry.content:
Hi guys,

we¬¥re currently in the process of connecting our datasphere to S/4HANA on-Prem using ABAP SQL services for data federation. We¬¥re struggling to establish the connection with S/4HANA

During setup we followed the official documentation:

  • Cloud Connector: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/9f804b8efa8043539289f42f372c4862/f289920243a34127b0c8b13012a1a4b5.html?locale=en-US
  • ABAP SQL Services: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/9f804b8efa8043539289f42f372c4862/4d7474595a5b41bb986616262ff44a3a.html?locale=en-US

 

We get the following error message when trying to import remote tables in datasphere.

 

According to SAP Note 3076454 we have to install the ODBC driver on S4. However S4 team informed us no ODBC is required on S4 side but the pre-installed in datasphere is sufficient. Hence I¬¥m a bit confused whether ODBC is needed on S4 for our scenario, any thoughts from your side?

In addition we have already checked Note 3586001 (https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3586001), but haven¬¥t been able to resolve this matter.

 

We¬¥ve already double checked:

  • Cloud connector settings
  • Firewall (hanacloud.ondemand.com / k8s-hana.ondemand.com) and whitelisting all necessary IPs

Everything seems fine.

 

The S4 connection is validated reachable in cloud connector.

 

We looked into the cloud connector logs and see a failing handshake request and terminated connection due to SSL/TLS communication. Any advice how to approach this matter further? Looks to me we might have some certificate issues between cloud connector ‚Äì BTP ‚Äì Datapshere - S4, but that¬¥s not really my area of expertise.

 

Any help appreciated!

entry.title: SAP Datasphere ‚Äì How to monitor real-time data replication status (jobs, memory, failures) & trigger
entry.content: We are looking to automate monitoring for real-time data replication in SAP Datasphere. Today, we manually check the Data Integration Monitor in Test/Prod for errors, but we want to build an alerting system that proactively notifies us when issues occur. Specifically, we need clarity on which underlying tables, views, or APIs store details about ongoing replication for remote tables‚Äîsuch as run status, timestamps, and any available runtime or resource metrics‚Äîso we can track jobs while they are running, not only after completion. Our goal is to automatically detect running jobs, monitor memory consumption where possible, and send immediate email notifications if a job fails or behaves abnormally. Any guidance, including which technical objects to query or recommended approaches for implementing automated alerts, would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Question about Data Products with Live Access in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm working with a Data Product that is based on a live connection (Delivery Mode: Live Access). When a user installs this Data Product in a space, the user receives a view.
However, when the underlying view changes, these changes are not reflected in the installed Data Product.

My question:
Is it possible for a Data Product using Live Access to automatically pick up changes made to the underlying view?
If yes, how can this be achieved?

From what I understand, ‚ÄúEdit Release‚Äù only applies to Data Products using Full Replication, not Live Access.

Any insights would be greatly appreciated, this would really help me.

Thanks and best regards

entry.title: How to Export Analytical Model Output from SAP Datasphere to Azure Data Lake Storage?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a requirement where I need to export the output of an Analytical Model in SAP Datasphere into Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS).

Connections to both Datasphere and Azure are already established.

Question:
Is there a way to export Analytical Model data into ADLS?

I attempted to create a Replication Flow with Datasphere as the source. However, when selecting the source object, I only see:

  • Local Tables

  • Fact Views

  • Dimension Views

The Analytical Models do not appear as selectable source objects.

Has anyone implemented this scenario or knows if Analytical Models are supported in Replication Flows or if there is an alternative approach?

Thanks in advance!

 

SAP Datasphere Cloud Integration Cloud Connector
